endpoints_summary.summary: Update asynchronous HTTP request Workflow block

details.description:
List workflows.

API key must have the `View workflows` permission.

parameters.description: When true, returns the list of actions for each workflow. Defaults to false.
parameters.name: includeActions

parameters.description: When set, only returns workflows with the given substring in the name or description.
parameters.name: searchQuery

parameters.description: Number of results to return per page, between 1 and 1000. Default 250.
parameters.name: pageSize

details.description:
Create or update new workflow.

API key must have the `Edit workflows` permission.

**Note:** If a workflow with the same tag already exists, it will be updated.

Delete workflow by tag or ID.

API key must have the `Edit workflows` permission.

parameters.description: The tag or unique, auto-generated identifier for the workflow.
parameters.name: tagOrId

schema.description: Entity identifier - can be a tag or CID

details.description:
Retrieve workflow by tag or ID.

API key must have the `View workflows` permission.

parameters.description: The tag or unique, auto-generated identifier for the workflow.
parameters.name: tagOrId

schema.description: Entity identifier - can be a tag or CID

endpoints.summary: Update asynchronous HTTP request Workflow block

details.description:
Updates an asynchronous HTTP request Workflow block.

API key must have the `Edit workflow runs` permission.

parameters.description: The tag or unique, auto-generated identifier for the workflow.
parameters.name: tagOrId

schema.description: Entity identifier - can be a tag or CID

parameters.description: Callback ID; Provided by the Workflow block when it runs
parameters.name: callbackId

schema.description: Callback ID; Provided by the Workflow block when it runs

404.description: Workflow run or block not found

406.description: Workflow block is not waiting for callback

details.summary: Update asynchronous HTTP request Workflow block

createNewRepository.description: Whether the scaffolder should create a new repository. Defaults to `true`

createService.description: Whether the cortex service should be created.

inputOverrides.description: The input overrides for the scaffolder

scaffolderTemplateId.description: The ID of the scaffolder template

defaultValue.description: The default value for the input

disabled.description: Whether the input should be disabled

format.description: The number format of the input

max.description: The maximum value of the input

min.description: The minimum value of the input

additionalProperties.description: The headers for the HTTP request

headers.description: The headers for the HTTP request

httpMethod.description: The HTTP method for the request

branches.description: The list of conditional branches that will be evaluated in order

joiningAction.description: The joining action that will run after all branches

allowMultiple.description: Whether the input allows multiple values. Defaults to `false`

defaultValue.description: The default value for the input

items.description: The default value for the input

shouldDisplayOptionsAsHierarchy.description: Whether the options should be displayed as a hierarchy. Defaults to `false`

isRootAction.description: Whether the action is the root action of the workflow. There can be only one root action per workflow

outgoingActions.description: The actions that will be executed after this action

items.description: The actions that will be executed after this action

WorkflowAction.description: List of actions in the workflow

expression.description: The JQ expression for the action

alias.description: The alias for the github configuration to be used

branch.description: The branch in the repository where the changes will be applied (optional; defaults to the main branch if not specified)

commitMessage.description: A message describing the purpose of the commit

content.description: The content of the file to be created or updated (not base64-encoded)

path.description: The full path to the file within the repository

repositoryName.description: The name of the repository where the file is being created or updated

ownershipScope.description: The ownership scope for the workflow

types.description: The entity types to include. Can be found on https://app.getcortexapp.com/admin/entities

items.description: The entity types to include. Can be found on https://app.getcortexapp.com/admin/entities

additionalProperties.description: The headers for the HTTP request

headers.description: The headers for the HTTP request

httpMethod.description: The HTTP method for the request

timeoutInSeconds.description: The timeout for the request in seconds

alias.description: The alias for the Jira configuration that will be used.

assignee.description: The identifier of the assignee for the Jira issue. This field is optional.

components.description: A list of components within the Jira project to which the issue belongs. This field is optional.

items.description: A list of components within the Jira project to which the issue belongs. This field is optional.

description.description: A detailed description of the issue, providing more context about what needs to be addressed.

additionalProperties.description: A map containing additional fields that are to be provided for the Jira issue, such as custom fields or extra attributes. This field is optional.

fields.description: A map containing additional fields that are to be provided for the Jira issue, such as custom fields or extra attributes. This field is optional.

issueSummary.description: A brief summary of the issue being created, typically representing the title of the issue.

issueType.description: The type of the issue being created, such as 'Bug', 'Task', or 'Story'.

labels.description: A list of labels or tags to categorize or highlight the Jira issue. This field is optional.

items.description: A list of labels or tags to categorize or highlight the Jira issue. This field is optional.

priority.description: The priority of the issue, such as 'High', 'Medium', or 'Low'. This field is optional.

projectKey.description: The key of the Jira project where the issue will be created. Typically a short code like 'PROJ'.

reporter.description: The identifier of the reporter who is raising the Jira issue. This field is optional.

editable.description: Whether the override is editable by the user. Defaults to `false`. If set to `true` it'll pause the execution of the workflow and wait for the user to provide the value

outputVariable.description: The path to the override value in the workflow context

WorkflowInput.description: The list of inputs required for the action

allowMultiple.description: Whether the input allows multiple values. Defaults to `false`

defaultValue.description: The default value for the input

items.description: The default value for the input

channel.description: The channel name to send the message to, without the `#`. For example for `#general` use `general`

allowAdditionalOptions.description: Whether additional options are allowed. Defaults to `false`

defaultValue.description: The default value for the input

options.description: The list of options for the input

items.description: The list of options for the input

optionsLabels.description: The list of labels for the options. If not provided, the options will be used as labels

items.description: The list of labels for the options. If not provided, the options will be used as labels

placeholder.description: The placeholder value for the input

message.description: Human readable message to be shown to the user

additionalProperties.description: Response from the callback request. If set, must be a JSON object

response.description: Response from the callback request. If set, must be a JSON object

status.description: Status of the callback request. `UPDATE` keeps the workflow paused

approverDescription.description: A description that will be shown to approvers

approvingTeamIds.description: The IDs of the teams whose members can approve the action

items.description: The IDs of the teams whose members can approve the action

outgoingAction.description: The first action to execute in this branch path

Fallback.description: The fallback branch that will be taken if no other branches evaluate to `true`

type.description: The type of the workflow filter

teamId.description: The team id to send the message to
